column6: To be sure, there were many more literary writers than Ted Cole among the alumni - Thomas and Timothy had gone to Exeter because Ted was an alumnus - but Minty O'Hare, who had managed only four years earlier to persuade Ted Cole to part with $82, 000, knew that Ted was an easy touch.

column6: The point is : Eddie wrote familiar, autobiographical novels - all of them variations on an overworked theme - and despite the carefulness with which he wrote ( he had a lucid prose style ), and a faithfulness to time and place ( and to characters who were credible, and who stayed in character ), his novels lacked imagination; or else, when he made an effort to allow his imagination looser rein, his novels lacked believability.
column7: Celý problém spočíval v tom, že ačkoliv Eddie napsal slušně známé autobiografické romány - všechny jsou variacemi na otřelé téma a navzdory pečlivosti, s níž psal ( styl jeho prózy je průzračný ) a věrnosti času a místu ( a postavám, jež jsou věrohodné a věrné samy sobě ) - postrádají představivost, nebo když se snažil své představivosti uvolnit pouta, věrohodnost.

column6: When he got tired, he lay down on the floor of the court, perfectly positioned on the T, the spot on the court he 'd always told Ruth to take possession of - to occupy, as if her life depended on it, because it was the position on the court from which you could best control the play of your opponent.
